DOC.brief_summary: This randomize , single blind , control study intracoronary cocktail injection fractional flow reserve ( FFR ) measurement guide percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) patient acute coronary syndrome ( ACS ) .
DOC.brief_title: Cocktail Injection Improves Outcomes FFR Guided PCI
DOC.detailed_description: This randomize , single blind , control study intracoronary cocktail injection fractional flow reserve ( FFR ) measurement guide percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) patient acute coronary syndrome ( ACS ) . Patients ACS randomize cocktail plus FFR guide group QCA guide group . The primary outcome cocktail II study composite death , myocardial infarction , class IV heart failure target vessel revascularization within 1 year . The secondary outcome cocktail II study include leave ventricular function , quality life , stroke life-threatening bleeding within 1 year .
DOC.criteria: patient clinical diagnosis recent ACS within 5 day haemodynamic instability intolerance antiplatelet drug ineligible coronary revascularization treatment plan noncoronary heart surgery ( e.g . valve surgery ) history prior PCI CABG angiographic evidence severe ( e.g . diffuse calcification ) mild ( ï¼œ30 % severity ) coronary disease life expectancy le 1 year adenosine allergy
